edu.um.cps2002.tile_game

Class PlayerMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.um.cps2002.tile_game.Map
      • edu.um.cps2002.tile_game.PlayerMap

  • public class PlayerMap
extends Map
    The PlayerMap class implements a Map object, with the additional methods generate() which populates the map with undiscovered (?) characters and htmlMapTable(int, int) which generates an HTML table representation of the map.
    Author:
    Luke Collins & Stefania Damato

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.um.cps2002.tile_game.Map

        size, tiles

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerMap(int size)
      Constructor, creates a map of desired size.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void generate()
      Sets each entry of the Map.tiles array as ? (unknown).
      (package private) java.lang.String htmlMapTable(int currentPlayerX, int currentPlayerY)
      This generates an HTML table representation of the map, placing the unicode character 👨 where the player is, unless they are on the treasure in which case the character 🏁 is placed instead.

      • Methods inherited from class edu.um.cps2002.tile_game.Map

        getSize, getTileType, setTile

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        void generate()
        Sets each entry of the Map.tiles array as ? (unknown).
        Specified by:
        generate in class Map

      • htmlMapTable

        java.lang.String htmlMapTable(int currentPlayerX,
                              int currentPlayerY)
        This generates an HTML table representation of the map, placing the unicode character 👨 where the player is, unless they are on the treasure in which case the character 🏁 is placed instead.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerX - Current row of the player in Map.tiles array.
        currentPlayerY - Current column of the player in Map.tiles array.
        Returns:
        A String containing an HTML table representation of the map.
